page.title: 05BALEDGARNO NEAR ABERNYTE
page.content: Baledgarno was neatly planned when it was built in 1784. All the houses are identical.They are single storey red sandstone cottages which have pale blue doors and white window frames.The back gardens are about a quarter of an acre.Burnside is a small market garden to the south of the hamlet. The entrance to Rossie Priory, Lord Kinnaird's house and owner of Baledgarno,is in the hamlet.There is a post box built into the rounded wall of The Reading Room,once the Library of Baledgarno and now a house.The post box is emptied daily.There is a telephone box.Baledgarno Burn runs beside the road,under 2 bridges.The main street is a dead end.Baledgarno is an attractive and quaint spot tucked away in a peaceful corner of our community.
